result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas L Knutowski
Current: HOMELESS,   (Effective: 09-15-2022)
Prior: 600 E North St,#2, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant to have no contact with Waukesha Metro Transit listed in the Criminal Complaint except for transportation and bus information.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and/or drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

1:14 PM Defendant Thomas L Knutowski in court, in custody. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ricardo Tapia appears as friend of the court. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
